revised_title: Roman Archaeology: Unearthing a Roman Town Near Leeds, England
tldr: In a letter to the Royal Society, Mr. Thoresby describes the discovery of vestiges of a Roman town near Leeds, Yorkshire. He discusses the excavation of foundations, walls, and other structures, as well as the discovery of Roman artifacts such as statues, inscriptions, and pottery. The letter also mentions the Roman road network in the area and the possible identification of the site with a location mentioned in ancient texts.
